definitions.definition: of the highest quality, or being the most suitable, pleasing, or effective type of thing or person:
examples: This is the best meal I've ever had.

definitions.definition: in the most suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to the greatest degree:
examples: Which evening would suit you best for the party?

definitions.definition: to the greatest degree when used as the superlative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well":
examples: They were the best-dressed couple at the party.
It is a difficult passage, but just translate it as best you can.

definitions.definition: the most excellent in a group of things or people:
examples: My tastes are simple - I only like the best.

definitions.definition: used to say goodbye, or to end a letter to someone you know well, or to send good wishes to someone:
examples: All the best to your parents!

definitions.definition: even when considered in the most positive way:
examples: The food was bland at best, and at worst completely inedible.

definitions.definition: at the highest standard that can be achieved:
examples: The documentary was an example of investigative journalism at its best.

definitions.definition: to be as active or intelligent as you can be:
examples: I'm not at my best in the morning.

definitions.definition: this is the most pleasing thing:
examples: There was wonderful food, good company, and, best of all, a jazz band.

definitions.definition: used to wish someone success before a test, etc. or a difficult activity:
examples: US Best of luck on your finals!

definitions.definition: In a sport such as tennis, if you play the best of a particular number of games, you play that number of games and the winner is the player who wins the greatest number of those games:
examples: Shall we play the best of five?

definitions.definition: to make the greatest effort possible:
examples: It doesn't matter if you fail, just do your best.

definitions.definition: If you have had the best of something, you have enjoyed the most pleasant part of it, and everything that is left is worse:
examples: I think we've already had the best of the hot weather this summer.
Just do the job to the best of your ability.

definitions.definition: from what I know and understand from the information that I have:
examples: To the best of my knowledge, the chemicals which were found are not dangerous.

definitions.definition: If an action is for the best, it is done to improve a situation or produce a good result, although it might seem unpleasant at the time:
examples: Ending a relationship is always hard but in this case it's for the best.

definitions.definition: to make an unsatisfactory situation as pleasant as possible:
examples: We'll have to spend the night here, so we might as well make the best of it.

definitions.definition: to defeat someone in a fight or competition:
examples: He bested his opponent in just two rounds.
